author: Special Correspondent
text:
A Sub-Court in Virudhunagar on Tuesday awarded seven years’ imprisonment to 10 persons, including four from Kerala, on a charge of dealing with counterfeit currency notes, totalling around Rs. 4.74 lakh.

Crime Branch-Criminal Investigation Department (Counterfeit Currency Wing), Madurai, arrested the accused in February 2009.

The police recovered the fake currency notes from them at different places after they first arrested S. Ameer Amsa (45) of Sivakasi and G. Manoharan (45) of M. Puliyankulam at Meenambigai Bungalow bus stop in Virudhunagar on February 13, 2009.

According to prosecution, the police recovered a computer and other paraphernalia from the accused, including E. Sasi (40), V. Ravi (43), Jelastin Lopez (52) and T. Sunil (34), all from Kerala.

All the accused were booked for criminal conspiracy and under four Sections of the Indian Penal Code relating to counterfeit currency notes – performing any part of the process of counterfeiting, circulating counterfeit currency notes, possession and making or possessing instruments or materials for forging or counterfeiting currency notes, Additional Public Prosecutor K. Ramdhas said.

Sub-Judge M.E. Padma found all the 10 accused guilty of criminal conspiracy. They were awarded one year jail term and asked to pay a fine of Rs. 1000 each.

While two persons from Kerala were found guilty on four counts, two others were found guilty on three counts and six persons on two counts.

The punishment on each charge is seven years.

However, the court ordered them to undergo the jail term concurrently.

The total fine amount ranged from Rs. 11,000 to Rs. 21,000.
title: Seven-year jail for ten persons
